lead_paragraph: This weekend is the kickoff for the first Cider Week in New York, which runs from Sunday through Oct. 23. There will be more than 85 restaurants throughout the city and Hudson Valley participating in the weeklong celebration of fermented apple juice. Consider the New Amsterdam Market, South Street (between Beekman Street and Peck Slip), which is holding a hard-cider revival on Sunday from noon to 4 p.m. with hard-cider tastings, Marlow and Sons is running a cider bar, and tapas-size snacks. Early admission is from noon to 1:30 p.m., with $45 tickets, which includes 10 tastings. General admission starts at 1:30 p.m., with five tastings for $20 and 10 for $35. Additional tastings are $5 each.
